abstract.p: Billiton PLC of Britain agrees to increase its stake in an Australian aluminum refinery by buying the majority interest of Alcoa Inc for $1.49 billion; Alcoa must sell its stake in refinery to satisfy antitrust regulators as part of its acquisition of Reynolds Metals Co (S)

block.p: The British mining company Billiton P.L.C., one of the largest producers of aluminum worldwide, agreed to increase its stake in an Australian aluminum refinery by buying the majority interest of Alcoa Inc. for $1.49 billion. The deal follows Billiton's announcement Friday that it would buy Rio Algom, a Toronto-based mining and metals distributor, for $1.2 billion. Alcoa must sell its stake in the Worsley aluminum refinery to satisfy anti-trust regulators as part of its acquisition earlier this year of the Reynolds Metals Company, which owns 56 percent of the Western Australia-based Worsley. Billiton already owns 30 percent of the Worsley refinery.
